medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began suddenly last night at 5pm, lasting for 6 hours prior to seeking care. The pain radiated to the back and was severe enough to cause breathlessness. It worsened with food. The patient experienced similar episodes of colicky pain in the past week that were of sudden onset and lasted several hours, which were not relieved by Maalox. Over the last 3 months, the patient had similar, less severe episodes lasting about an hour, occurring in the latter part of the day, for which a PPI was prescribed without improvement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Uterine fibroids, Myomectomy, Uterine artery embolization.
medical_history.family_history: Mother has hypertension; Father has hyperlipidemia and bladder cancer; Paternal Uncle has cancer.
